meanings.definition: A loud, harsh, or discordant noise.
meanings.sent1: The squawk of the parrot startled me.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud squawk coming from the crow outside.
meanings.sent3: The squawk of the seagull interrupted our peaceful picnic.
meanings.sent4: The car brakes made a squawk as it came to a sudden stop.
meanings.sent5: The squawk of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise.
meanings.sent1: The geese squawked loudly as they flew overhead.
meanings.sent2: The old door squawked when I opened it slowly.
meanings.sent3: The rusty swing set squawked with each push.
meanings.sent4: The tires squawked as the car skidded on the wet road.
meanings.sent5: The seagull squawked in annoyance when I got too close.

meanings.sent1: Her constant squawk about the weather was getting tiresome.
meanings.sent2: The customer's squawk about the service was heard by the manager.
meanings.sent3: The cat's squawk for more treats was met with a playful laugh.
meanings.sent4: The squawk of the toddler for attention filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The employee's squawk for better working conditions was taken seriously.
